tn.ref: assigned the king's portion for the burnt offerings from his own possessions
tn.text: Hezekiah took the meat and grain used for the burnt offerings out of his own possessions.
This was a festival coinciding with the movement of the moon.
This references festivals which occur on specific dates.

This is the third month of the Hebrew calendar. It is at the end of the harvest season and the beginning of the dry season. It is during the last part of May and the first part of June on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

This is the seventh month of the Hebrew calendar. This is during the early rain season, which would soften the land for sowing. It is during the last part of September and the first part of October on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
